definition: festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)

sentences.english: Metronomes should not be over used.
sentences.chinese: 節拍器也不應當被濫用。

sentences.english: From hip-pop to the non-stop rhythm of the city.
sentences.chinese: 從嘻哈音樂到永無休止的城市節拍。

sentences.english: A metronome might be used for this gradual speed-up.
sentences.chinese: 在慢慢增加速度的時候，節拍器也常被用到。
那節拍器擺動着顯示節拍。
那節拍器擺動着顯示節拍。

sentences.english: We stood, waited for the beat, and tried again.
sentences.chinese: 我們站住，等待合適的節拍，接着跳。

sentences.english: The song has a syncopated rhythm in the jazz version.
sentences.chinese: 這首歌曲改編爲爵士樂後接納了切分音節拍。

sentences.english: The primitive dance also has the metre which raps or sings toaccompany with.
sentences.chinese: 原始的舞蹈也有敲擊出來的節拍或歌唱相伴和。

sentences.english: This is used to provide note values, as well as creating a basic tempo dictation.
sentences.chinese: 這可用於提供通知值，以及創建基本的節拍命令。

sentences.english: It’s not the same beats season after season.
sentences.chinese: 它每一季的節拍都不相同。

sentences.english: She had millions of listeners snapping their fingers to her first single…
sentences.chinese: 百萬聽衆和着她第一首歌的節拍打着響指。

sentences.english: GigBaby! four track recorder, metronome, drum machine.
sentences.chinese: 四軌錄音機，節拍器，鼓機。
節拍器能夠拯救你的生命。

sentences.english: What are the distinctions between figural and metric structures?
sentences.chinese: 在音形和節拍的結構間的差異是什麼？

sentences.english: As the music beats, the shirts equalizer lights up to the beat of the music.
sentences.chinese: 隨着音樂的不同節拍，汗衫上的均衡器就會隨之亮起。

definition: part (in multi-part instrumental or choral music), such as the soprano part or bass part
pitch of voice (high or low)/pitch (of a musical note)/tone
to sway/to swing/to move back and forth/to oscillate
to move as in a dance/to wave (some implement)/to flourish/(of eyes, hands etc) to dance/to flutter
to do something at one go/to flow smoothly
to be fired up (idiom)/to have one's blood racing
